column5: Man what a tough couple of weeks hooking up and landing. 3 hours of drifting and casting this morning when finally, a fish to play with. The water is so cold, they do not fight like they do in October. Screaming and jumping all about. This one hit like I was caught on bottom. The yellow tip of the float slowllllyyyy went under. A lift of the rod and there was weight on the end. Was a quick sluggish battle. A fish is a fish,no matter.
Nice going Mr B.  I was working...
Love the lululemon, waders. Fish looks good too.
Did you have the place all to yourself? It's been really really slow this last while!!  I haven't bothered because I see folks come and catch very little.
Ya, . The whole morning, just me and me bye. I got that one under da tree, down from de isle bye.  Not a hippy to be seen.
I am impressed by the rod balancing act...if only you had two trout you could juggle them while still balancing rod...that would be a sight
Eastern ditches are really streaky. Yesterday nothing caught by anybody till 11:30 then game on. Still fighting good no jumps but still ripping.
Thats what my buddy said this morning. He was down there this week.
has that ever happened on a Sat before? esp in that spot?
slow days on the river better than no days on the river
Nice fish. Counting down the days till lady S ice fishing.  Winter is coming.

And this morning, I was up the road a ways.  Not another fisherman to be seen. Nor a fish. LOL But did sit by a small fire and had coffee and listen to the woods awaken. That was so peaceful. I am seeing , more and more fish ducks on the river this year. Never seen that before.
